page.title: 12HOUSING IN KEMPSEY.
page.content: The housing in Kempsey ranges from Pre Georgian to very modern. Most of the houses have been built in the last 50 years. These 'modern' houses have reasonable sized gardens and most of the houses are big. The houses are built from red brick near the centre of the village. The older houses seem to be situated further out from the village centre. This is because they were built to be near the farms. It is the growth of the new housing estates that has made Kempsey one of the largest villages in the country. One of the reasons for this growth is that in the late 20th century, people who spent all of the day working in cities wanted somewhere 'quiet' to come home to in the evening. Kempsey's proximity to the M5 motorway makes it an ideal place for such a home.
